alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 5:10AM MST until September 01 at 12:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and west central Arizona, including the following areas, in north central Arizona, Coconino Plateau, Grand Canyon Country and Kaibab Plateau. In west central Arizona, Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons, Western Mogollon Rim, Yavapai County Mountains and Yavapai County Valleys and Basins. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, and swimming holes. Low-water crossings could also become flooded, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A surge of subtropical moisture will bring multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms to the region. Periods of heavy rainfall will be possible both during the daytime and nighttime hours. Soils may easily become saturated, increasing the risk for flash flooding. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
